title: Reading dlf files
text: start reading single dlf file inspect contents. use Soil chemical log bundled daisyrVis read read_dlf. read_dlf returns S4 object class Dlf. data dlf file stored three slots Dlf object, header, units, body header slot list metadata stored actual data dlf file. units slot data.frame unit information data column. body slot data.frame containing data. slot accessed @ operator
code: data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package="daisyrVis") path <- file.path(data_dir, "hourly/P2D-Daily-Soil_Chemical_110cm.dlf") dlf <- read_dlf(path) slotNames(dlf) #> [1] "header" "units"  "body" dlf@header #> $info #> [1] "dlf-0.0 -- Soil chemical (defined in 'log-std.dai')." #>  #> $VERSION #> [1] "6.41" #>  #> $LOGFILE #> [1] "P2D-Daily-Soil Chemical_110cm.dlf" #>  #> $RUN #> [1] "Thu Aug 31 10" #>  #> $COLUMN #> [1] "*" #>  #> $CHEMICAL #> [1] "P2d" #>  #> $INTERVAL #> [1] "box [-110; none]" #>  #> $LOG #> [1] "Content, transport and transformation of chemicals in the soil." #>  #> $SIMFILE #> [1] "Sim2-1d-Maize-P2p-d.dai" dlf@units #>   year month mday hour In_Matrix In_Biopores Leak_Matrix Leak_Biopores #> 1                           g/ha        g/ha        g/ha          g/ha #>   Biopores.to.matrix Matrix.to.biopores Tillage Drain_Soil Drain_Biopores #> 1               g/ha               g/ha    g/ha       g/ha           g/ha #>   Drain_Biopores_Indirect External Uptake Decompose Transform Content Biopores #> 1                    g/ha     g/ha   g/ha      g/ha      g/ha    g/ha     g/ha #>   Error #> 1  g/ha head(dlf@body) #>   year month mday hour In_Matrix In_Biopores  Leak_Matrix Leak_Biopores #> 1 1995     1    1    0         0           0 -0.000208120             0 #> 2 1995     1    1    1         0           0 -0.000207217             0 #> 3 1995     1    1    2         0           0 -0.000206316             0 #> 4 1995     1    1    3         0           0 -0.000205415             0 #> 5 1995     1    1    4         0           0 -0.000204516             0 #> 6 1995     1    1    5         0           0 -0.000203618             0 #>   Biopores.to.matrix Matrix.to.biopores Tillage Drain_Soil Drain_Biopores #> 1                  0                  0       0          0              0 #> 2                  0                  0       0          0              0 #> 3                  0                  0       0          0              0 #> 4                  0                  0       0          0              0 #> 5                  0                  0       0          0              0 #> 6                  0                  0       0          0              0 #>   Drain_Biopores_Indirect External Uptake  Decompose  Transform Content #> 1                       0        0      0 0.00301612 0.00227715 60.5101 #> 2                       0        0      0 0.00300712 0.00225974 60.5095 #> 3                       0        0      0 0.00299438 0.00223681 60.5090 #> 4                       0        0      0 0.00297959 0.00221215 60.5084 #> 5                       0        0      0 0.00296299 0.00218613 60.5078 #> 6                       0        0      0 0.00294491 0.00215918 60.5073 #>      Biopores Error #> 1 9.80239e-19     0 #> 2 9.80239e-19     0 #> 3 9.80239e-19     0 #> 4 9.80239e-19     0 #> 5 9.80239e-19     0 #> 6 9.80239e-19     0

what: Reading a directory with dlf files
title: Reading dlf files
text: use tracer field nitrogen logs bundled daisyrVis read read_dlf_dir Notice path directory, instead file reading single dlf file. read_dlf_dir returns list Dlf objects get specific dlf just index list name names file paths, can bit unwieldly. can either manually change names use convenience functions drop_dir_from_names strip_common_prefix_from_names
code:
data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package="daisyrVis") path <- file.path(data_dir, "annual") dlfs <- read_dlf_dir(path) names(dlfs) #> [1] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b"         #> [2] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-3b"         #> [3] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-4b"         #> [4] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-5b"         #> [5] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-2b" #> [6] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-3b" #> [7] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-4b" #> [8] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-5b" name <- names(dlfs)[1] name #> [1] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b" dlfs[[name]]@header #> $info #> [1] "dlf-0.0 -- Field nitrogen (defined in 'log-std.dai')." #>  #> $VERSION #> [1] "6.41" #>  #> $LOGFILE #> [1] "Annual-FN.dlf" #>  #> $RUN #> [1] "Mon Aug 28 16" #>  #> $COLUMN #> [1] "*" #>  #> $INTERVAL #> [1] "box none" #>  #> $LOG #> [1] "Nitrogen input, output, transformation and content for the system.

The intended use of this log is large scale nitrogen balance, for
example reservoir management. It provide information about how
much nitrogen is in the field (down to a specified depth), where
it is located in the field (surface, soil matrix or in biopores),
what form is has (crop, soil organic matter, or mineral) as well
as the sources, sinks and amounts of nitrogen entering or leaving
the system, and transformation between the four forms.  It does
not provide information about internal translocation of nitrogen
between surface, soil matrix and biopores, use see the 'Soil
nitrogen' log instead for that.

For the balances of this log to work, you must include the entire
root zone" #>  #> $SIMFILE #> [1] "Runfile2b.dai" #>  #> $SIM #> [1] "Arable farm rotation; Soil" dlfs <- drop_dir_from_names(dlfs) names(dlfs) #> [1] "HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b"     "HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-3b"     #> [3] "HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-4b"     "HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-5b"     #> [5] "HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-2b" "HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-3b" #> [7] "HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-4b" "HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-5b" dlfs <- strip_common_prefix_from_names(dlfs) names(dlfs) #> [1] "FN-2-2b"     "FN-2-3b"     "FN-2-4b"     "FN-2-5b"     "Tracer-2-2b" #> [6] "Tracer-2-3b" "Tracer-2-4b" "Tracer-2-5b" names(dlfs) <- c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E", "F", "G", "H") names(dlfs) #> [1] "A" "B" "C" "D" "E" "F" "G" "H" dlfs[["A"]]@header #> $info #> [1] "dlf-0.0 -- Field nitrogen (defined in 'log-std.dai')." #>  #> $VERSION #> [1] "6.41" #>  #> $LOGFILE #> [1] "Annual-FN.dlf" #>  #> $RUN #> [1] "Mon Aug 28 16" #>  #> $COLUMN #> [1] "*" #>  #> $INTERVAL #> [1] "box none" #>  #> $LOG #> [1] "Nitrogen input, output, transformation and content for the system.

The intended use of this log is large scale nitrogen balance, for
example reservoir management. It provide information about how
much nitrogen is in the field (down to a specified depth), where
it is located in the field (surface, soil matrix or in biopores),
what form is has (crop, soil organic matter, or mineral) as well
as the sources, sinks and amounts of nitrogen entering or leaving
the system, and transformation between the four forms.  It does
not provide information about internal translocation of nitrogen
between surface, soil matrix and biopores, use see the 'Soil
nitrogen' log instead for that.

For the balances of this log to work, you must include the entire
root zone" #>  #> $SIMFILE #> [1] "Runfile2b.dai" #>  #> $SIM #> [1] "Arable farm rotation; Soil"

previous_headings: Reading a directory with dlf files
title: Reading dlf files
text: read_dlf_dir takes optional pattern parameter can used control files included. default files suffix .dlf included. want read files ending 2b.dlf, can pattern regular expression. around see can find shorter pattern results files read.
code: data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package="daisyrVis") path <- file.path(data_dir, "annual") pattern <- ".*2b\\.dlf" dlfs <- read_dlf_dir(path, pattern) names(dlfs) #> [1] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b"         #> [2] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-2b"

what: Make a bar plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_annual

text: Make bar plot one variables one dlfs

title: Make a bar plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_annual
Make a bar plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_annual
text: dlfs Either list Dlf single Dlf. list components, names used legend. variables Either list variables plot, single variable title_suffix string appended title subplots

title: Make a bar plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_annual
text: ggplot2

title: Make a bar plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_annual
code: # Load dlf data with read_dlf data_dir <- file.path(system.file("extdata", package="daisyrVis"),                       "annual/Annual-FN") scenarios <- list("2-2b"="HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b.dlf",                   "2-3b"="HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-3b.dlf",                   "2-4b"="HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-4b.dlf",                   "2-5b"="HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-5b.dlf") dlfs <- lapply(scenarios, function(fname) {     read_dlf(file.path(data_dir, fname)) }) # Be careful with variable names. R does not like - so it is replaced with _ vars <- c("Matrix_Leaching", "Crop_Uptake", "Soil_Drain", "Surface_Loss") plot_annual(dlfs, vars, " - Annual Field Nitrogen")

what: Make a scatter plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_daily
title: Make a scatter plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_daily
text: Make scatter plot one variables one dlfs

title: Make a scatter plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_daily
code: plot_daily(dlfs, variables, hour = 0, title_suffix = "", plot_line = FALSE)

title: Make a scatter plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_daily
text: dlfs Either list Dlf single Dlf. list components, names used legend. variables Either list variables plot, single variable hour hour plot title_suffix string appended title subplots plot_line TRUE plot points line otherwise plot points

title: Make a scatter plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_daily
text: ggplot2

title: Make a scatter plot of one or more variables from one or more dlfs — plot_daily
code: ## Load dlf data with read_dlf data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package="daisyrVis") path <- file.path(data_dir, "hourly/P2D-Daily-Soil_Chemical_110cm.dlf") dlf <- read_dlf(path)  ## Be careful with variable names. R does not like - so it is replaced with _ vars <- c("Leak_Matrix", "Transform")  ## Plot a single dlf hour <- 0 plot_daily(dlf, vars, hour, paste0(" - Soil chemical @ hour ", hour), TRUE)   ## Plot multiple dlfs together dlf2 <- dlf dlf2@body[["Leak_Matrix"]] <-  dlf2@body[["Leak_Matrix"]] + 0.001 dlf2@body[["Transform"]] <-  dlf2@body[["Transform"]] + 0.05 dlfs <- list(original=dlf, derived=dlf2) hour <- hour + 2 plot_daily(dlfs, vars, hour, paste0(" - Soil chemical @ hour ", hour))

title: Plot one or more variables from one or more Dlfs with a user supplied geom. Each variable is plotted in a separate subplot. — plot_many
text: dlfs Either list Dlf single Dlf. list components, names  used legend. x_var Name variable x axis y_vars Either list variables plot, single variable geom single parameter function calling ggplot2 geom_* function. passed plot object parameter. title_suffix string appended title subplots x_var_is_posix_time Set TRUE x_var POSIXct class, e.g used daisy_time_to_timestamp

title: Plot one or more variables from one or more Dlfs with a user supplied geom. Each variable is plotted in a separate subplot. — plot_many
text: ggplot2

title: Plot one or more variables from one or more Dlfs with a user supplied geom. Each variable is plotted in a separate subplot. — plot_many
code: data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package="daisyrVis") path <- file.path(data_dir, "annual/Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b.dlf") dlf <- read_dlf(path) geom <- function(gg) { gg + ggplot2::geom_col(position="dodge") } plot_many(dlf, "year", "Crop", geom)

text: Read dlf file (Daisy log file)

title: Read a dlf file (Daisy log file) — read_dlf
Read a dlf file (Daisy log file) — read_dlf
text: path Path dlf file

title: Read a dlf file (Daisy log file) — read_dlf
text: S4 object class Dlf three slots: header, units, body header list everything dlf file data. key: value pairs header stored named components list. units data.framecontaining units values body. body data.frame containing logged values

title: Read a dlf file (Daisy log file) — read_dlf
code: data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package="daisyrVis") path <- file.path(data_dir, "annual/Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b.dlf") dlf <- read_dlf(path) slotNames(dlf) #> [1] "header" "units"  "body"   names(dlf@header) #> [1] "info"     "VERSION"  "LOGFILE"  "RUN"      "COLUMN"   "INTERVAL" "LOG"      #> [8] "SIMFILE"  "SIM"      dlf@units$Crop #> [1] "kg N/ha" dlf@body["Crop"] #>        Crop #> 1    0.0000 #> 2   27.9559 #> 3  138.0880 #> 4   11.4810 #> 5   24.6333 #> 6    0.0000 #> 7   10.8504 #> 8  133.5410 #> 9   34.2416 #> 10  35.3079 #> 11   0.0000

text: list S4 objects class Dlf. dlf named relative path

title: Walk a directory tree and read all dlf files in it. — read_dlf_dir
code: data_dir <- system.file("extdata", package="daisyrVis") dlfs <- read_dlf_dir(file.path(data_dir, "annual")) print(names(dlfs)) #> [1] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b"         #> [2] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-3b"         #> [3] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-4b"         #> [4] "Annual-FN/HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-5b"         #> [5] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-2b" #> [6] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-3b" #> [7] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-4b" #> [8] "Annual-Tracer/HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-5b"  dlfs <- drop_dir_from_names(dlfs) print(names(dlfs)) #> [1] "HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-2b"     "HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-3b"     #> [3] "HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-4b"     "HourlyP-Annual-FN-2-5b"     #> [5] "HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-2b" "HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-3b" #> [7] "HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-4b" "HourlyP-Annual-Tracer-2-5b"  dlfs <- strip_common_prefix_from_names(dlfs) print(names(dlfs)) #> [1] "FN-2-2b"     "FN-2-3b"     "FN-2-4b"     "FN-2-5b"     "Tracer-2-2b" #> [6] "Tracer-2-3b" "Tracer-2-4b" "Tracer-2-5b"
